titleStmt.title: To CATHERINE CHARLOTTE BEARDCatherine Charlotte Beard (1809-93), eldest sister of CD’s friend Thomas Beard (1807-91). She regularly socialised with the Dickens family; see, for example, To Beard, 16 & 21 July 1842 (Pilgrim Letters 3, pp. 273, 276), and 10 June 1844 (Pilgrim Letters 4, p. 143)

body.p: by forcing my liberty upon him.Presumably refers to a social engagement involving CD and Charlotte Beard's brother Thomas.

KateCatherine Dickens (née Hogarth, 1815-79), CD's wife. and her sisterGeorgina Hogarth (1827-1917), CD's sister-in-law. unite in love to you;For another instance of Catherine's and Georgina's sending their love to Catherine Beard see To Thomas Beard, 10 June 1844 (Pilgrim Letters 4, p. 143). and send their best regards to all your house.Catherine Beard lived with her brother and parents at 42 Portman Place, Edgware Road.

closer.salute: Believe me always | Dear Miss Beard | Faithfully Yours
